item.Description: An enumeration indicating the Electrometer detailed state. See the DetailedStateValue enumeration defined on top of this document.

SALEvent.Description: Current state of the digital filter setup. The Electrometer has two types of filters: Averaging and Median. Note that both filters can be enabled at the same time. In order to enable either of these filters, one must set the activateFilter to ON (1).

item.Description: If this is OFF, none of the filters will operate. 0 for not active and 1 for active

Activate the median filter inside the electrometer: 1 for active and 0 for not active. Will use the Default value of Rank (R) = 1, such that the number of samples that it will determine the median of is (2xR) + 1.
Activate the average filter inside the electrometer: 1 for active and 0 for not active. Will use the Default value inside the device (last 10 readings) to do the average calculation.

SALEvent.Description: The integration time (measurement speed) of the analog to digital (A/D) converter, the period of time the input signal is measured (also known as aperture). This will directly affect reading rates. Default is 16.67ms.

item.Description: Integration rate in seconds (166.67e-6 to 200e-3)

SALEvent.Description: Intensity of light measured with the photo-diode in the unit previously configured. NOT IMPLEMENTED

item.Description: Measure read by the device
Unit used
Timestamp when the measurement was taken

SALEvent.Description: Measurement range for the mode selected. This impacts the accuracy and max signal that can be measured (105% of the range). Auto-range is set at -1, will automatically go to the most sensitive range. Volts range from 0 to 210V, Current range from 0 to 21e-3Amps, Resistance from 0 to 100e18, Charge from 0 to +2.1e-6

item.Description: The range for the intensity for measure selected.

SALEvent.Description: Current mode selected to read from the photodiode. Options are Current, Charge, Voltage and Resistance.

item.Description: mode: 1- Current, 2- Charge, 3- Voltage, 4- Resistance

SALEvent.Description: Initial configuration of the electrometer, this has been set in the current configuration file in use

item.Description: Digital Filter configuration. If this is OFF, none of the filters will operate
Average digital filter status inside the electrometer, it uses the Default value inside the device (last 10 readings) to do the average calculation, true for ON and False for OFF

Ranges use to read values from the photodiode using the current Mode. -1 for automatic range. Volts range from 0 to 210V, Current range from 0 to 21e-3Amps, Resistance from 0 to 100e18, Charge from 0 to +2.1e-6
Integration rate, this will directly affect reading rates but reading rates are not going to be the same as reading rates

The median filter is used to determine the middle-most reading from a group of readings that are arranged according to size. Activate the median filter inside the electrometer, true for ON and False for OFF
Mode used in the configuration file, 0-Current, 1-Charge, 2-Voltage, 3-Resistance

SALEvent.Description: Serial configuration for the Electrometer port. This configuration needs to be the same as the one set in the Electrometer device. For proper configuration please read the reference manual 6517B-901-01 Rev. B / June 2009 section Selecting interface parameters

item.Description: Visa resource or port
Baud rate as a number. Allowed values are: 2400, 4800, 9600, 14400, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200
Parity checking. PARITY_NONE=0, PARITY_EVEN=1, PARITY_ODD=2, PARITY_MARK=3, PARITY_SPACE=4
Number of data bits. Possible values: 5, 6, 7, 8
Number of stop bits. Possible values: 1, 2
time out in seconds
termination char, endl for end line
Software flow control.
hardware (DSR/DTR) flow control
The maximum amount of bytes to read
The error code being published. This code is the same as the one that the Electrometer publishes
Handle a few sentences of higher-level information describing the error.

SALEvent.Description: The voltage source sends an output to the electrometer which can be written to the buffer.

item.Description: Is the voltage source enabled (true) or not (false)?
The voltage amplititude.
The voltage value to use along the range set by the voltage limit.
Set the voltage limit that can be used.
